alert.note: Alert for Clay; Hamilton; Nuckolls (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: High Wind Watch issued April 05 at 4:25AM CDT until April 07 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...HIGH WIND WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM TO 8 PM CDT WEDNESDAY... ...HIGH WIND WATCH IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY MORNING THROUGH THURSDAY EVENING... * WHAT...For the High Wind Warning, sustained northwest winds 30 to 45 MPH with gusts as high as 55 to 65 MPH expected. For the High Wind Watch, very similar northwest winds sustained at 30 to 45 mph with gusts as high as 55 to 65 MPH possible. * WHERE...Hamilton, Clay and Nuckolls Counties. * WHEN...For the High Wind Warning, from 10 AM to 8 PM CDT Wednesday. For the High Wind Watch, from Thursday morning through Thursday evening. * IMPACTS...Damaging winds could blow down trees and power lines. Widespread power outages are possible. Travel will be difficult, especially for high profile vehicles. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Although it is yet unclear how much of a visibility and travel issue it might cause across the area as a whole, at least some areas of blowing dust are likely to accompany these strong winds.
info.instruction: People should avoid being outside in forested areas and around trees and branches. If possible, remain in the lower levels of your home during the windstorm, and avoid windows. Use caution if you must drive.
